content.raw:
Thanks Ian. I can confirm a latency is noticed when doing the iperf test . The latency is noticed before the connection is established. 

The results of the iperf are the following: 

FC acting as the client (`iperf -c 192.168.2.150`): 
```
$ iperf -c 192.168.2.150
------------------------------------------------------------
Client connecting to 192.168.2.150, TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 45.0 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  3] local 192.168.2.10 port 52788 connected with 192.168.2.150 port 5001
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  3]  0.0-61.0 sec   256 KBytes  34.4 Kbits/sec
```

OCU as the client:
```
$ iperf -c 192.168.2.10
connect failed: Connection timed out
```
content.html:
Thanks Ian. I can confirm a latency is noticed when doing the iperf test . The latency is noticed before the connection is established.

The results of the iperf are the following:

FC acting as the client (iperf -c 192.168.2.150): 

$ iperf -c 192.168.2.150
------------------------------------------------------------
Client connecting to 192.168.2.150, TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 45.0 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  3] local 192.168.2.10 port 52788 connected with 192.168.2.150 port 5001
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  3]  0.0-61.0 sec   256 KBytes  34.4 Kbits/sec

OCU as the client:

$ iperf -c 192.168.2.10
connect failed: Connection timed out
